Thematically, our trainees and training program will have a central focus - innovative platform technologies for treatment and discovery.

PHR: PUBLIC HEALTH RELEVANCE: Scientific advances over the past 20 years have revolutionized how health and disease are understood. Evidence from neuroscience, molecular biology, genomics, and the behavioral and social sciences have shown that while biological systems continue to develop and change across the life course the foundations laid down in childhood are critical to lifetime health. PHR: PUBLIC HEALTH RELEVANCE: Scientific advances over the past 20 years have revolutionized how health and disease are understood. Evidence from neuroscience, molecular biology, genomics, and the behavioral and social sciences have shown that while biological systems continue to develop and change across the life course the foundations laid down in childhood are critical to lifetime health. With this paradigm shift, the research community is challenged to stimulate new research, to develop creative solutions for improving health, and to translate research findings into social policy that will optimize health. The proposed training program will prepare nurse scientists to meet these challenges by using a transformative life course health development model that integrates the health production models from individual and public health. This program will prepare nurse scientists to understand how biology and social and environmental contexts intersect during childhood to influence life course health development and to use this knowledge to develop rigorous interdisciplinary programs of research to optimize health.

PHR: Public Health Relevance Statement  The goal and mission of biomedical research, and NIH, is first to search for and discover fundamental knowledge about the nature and behavior of living systems and then to apply that knowledge to enhance health, lengthen life, and reduce the burdens of illness and disability. Additionally, this training is organized to promote the highest level of scientific integrity, public accountability, and social responsibility in the conduct of science.
